Description: Rim and body sherd of Corinthian Silhouette Style pottery kotyle with handle root; interior black (only traces remaining); exterior: frieze of verticals between bands at lip; below, three bands and silhouette style animal frieze (possibly an elongated goat) to right, with dot as filling ornament.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 219, no. 40)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 95, no. A131)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.248) (phase 3)
